name: Luke's Lobster Upper East Side
address: 242 E 81st St, New York, NY 10028, USA

reviews.text:
Iâ€™m extremely upset with the repeated issues Iâ€™ve had with this location. Iâ€™ve ordered from here at least 6â€“8 times, and almost every single time, something is missing. Today, I even called the store right after placing my order to confirm that everything would be correct â€” yet they still forgot two items.
What makes it worse is that this time, they didnâ€™t even apologize for the mistake. In the past, Iâ€™ve also had an order arrive a day late after being assured by the manager it would come the same day. Itâ€™s extremely frustrating and disappointing because the food itself is very good, but the constant mistakes and lack of accountability ruin the experience.

I got a 6oz lobster roll, a 6oz crab roll, and a 8oz  cup of lobster bisque.

The rolls were soft and sweet, and it was nicely toasted. The lobster meat was fresh and clean tasting. The crab meat was also pretty nice, too. They put just right amount of seasoning on the top. It was enough to enhance the flavor, and not too much to be overpowering. They were good rolls.

I was only worried about two things when I have seafood. One is that the food was not fresh and fishy, and the other was there were shells in it. They did the fresh part very nicely, however, I did find 3 tiny pieces of shell in my crab roll. I guess it was inevitable, so all is good.

The lobster bisque was quite nice, too. It was thick and flavorful. It was a bit too salty to my liking. There was one chunk of lobster claw in the bisque.

Overall, the food was nice. The service was meh, I ordered online, and when I go pick it up the server didnâ€™t even mention to grab my own chips that were included in my meal. I found out when I was walking across the street, and I had to go back and ask for it.
Best lobster rolls in the city â¤ï¸

This Lukes lobster location has very professional friendly attentive staff members it is very clean has a great atmosphere very inviting the food was fresh and delicious ğŸ˜‹  I had the trio lobster rolls with their ginger soda orderd to go lobster roll with thier lemonade. Everything was on point will be returning very soon.
Delicious lobster!

Locale a conduzione famigliare, con un ambiente caratteristico newyorkese.
Ottimo Lobster Roll, il panino Ã© farcito con la chela dell'astice ed ha un ottimo sapore.
It brings back memories in Maine. You need to pay $1 if you want a warm lobster roll.

The people who work here are gems! It is rare for a chain to feel like a neighborhood spot.
Terrific spot.   Food was excellent .   Great friendly service .     Will be back!
Yummy food, and Gluten-free buns! Best service consistently! These folks genuinely care about their customers, which is hard to find sometimes in the restaurant business!

Il miglior locale dove abbia mangiato a New York. Il gestore simpaticissimo e cordiale.
Cibo ottimo.
Un po' caro considerata la porzione, ma si sta pure sempre mangiando aragosta a New York...
Excellent
Great food at great prices
Amazing service and food! Albert made my birthday lobster roll dinner really special :) 11/10 customer experience
Amazing warm lobster roll - very fresh and tasty
not a single piece of lobster in the large bisque
Great lobster roll! Simple and delicious
Great service great food The lobster roll is cold lobster but there is an option to get warm butter lobster roll
Lobster Rolls here are so delicious and fresh. Jason and Brandonâ€™s customer service is superb

Il panino con lâ€™aragosta eâ€™ qualcosa di unico. Il prezzo Ã¨ diverso rispetto al classico sandwich ma vi assicuriamo che aragosta abbondante e gustosa come da Lukeâ€™s Lobster non la ritroverete! Tappa obbligata a NYC!
Lukeâ€™s is not handicapped accessible. Does not have a ramp to enter over stairs and bathroom non accessible.
Excellent staff, delicious and fresh food, comfortable and clean environment! Felt like I was back in Maine, loved it!
Super delicious clam chowder and lobster rolls
ë§›ìˆìŒ. ìƒ˜í”ŒëŸ¬ì—ë‹¤ê°€ ì½¤ë³´(ìŒë£Œ ì°¨ìš°ë”) í–ˆëŠ”ë° ë ˆëª¬ë²„í„°ë§›ì´ ì œì¼ ë§›ìˆìŒ.
Very good food.
Lobster roll fantastico ğŸ¦â¤ï¸

Food is good here, you get very little for the price you pay. We spent $70 (Â£54) for two rolls, two packets of crisps and two cokes which to me is a lot of money for a light lunch. Service is ok and it's a standard in NYC, I wouldn't expect mind-blowing service anywhere. It's a nice place to sit in.
Preso il panino con l'astice, freschissimo e saporito. Se si Ã¨ in zona Ã¨ da provare, una sola volta perÃ² perchÃ© Ã¨ davvero costoso!

I had some questions about the different sauces for the lobster rolls but the man behind the register was rude and impatient (the place was nearly empty too) That being said,the lobster was absolutely scrumptious.

On 9/11/2024 i went to the lukes lobster on the upper west side & 81st street around 12/1 pm & purchased a crab roll . normally im in and out but it did take her a while to make my order. i decided to take it to work so that i may eat it there because i had no time. My bread was so soggy i took one bite and had no choice but to discarded my meal & it was the last $20 i had. my crab roll was disappointing & my favorite item of the meal * the bun * was ruined with the crab water. my entire bun pretty much soaked up everything and it was displeasing to the touch. especially since i have sensory issues. Lukes is my favorite so i dont want this to be the reason i dont eat it no more but please do better

So 9/13/24..   i experienced the same incident But A nice & accommodating lady ensured my food was correctly fixed & made to my liking. i really appreciated how she actively listened to my issue,resolved the issue & gave me fresh food without ANY pushback . i really do appreciate your help today , i really wish i got her name. she was amazing !
The lobster roll is delicious & and it's small, so I get two, which is pretty pricey. I just wish they served fries instead of offering a bag of potato chips.
Small but cozy spot.

Terrible experience! The guy that took my order, rushed me and was rude. And it seems like he made the order. He left and came back in 3min. Food wasnâ€™t great. Premade food not the best. Food was too cold almost frozen. Donâ€™t recommend this place at all
Small, Tasteless, without even a potato chip.  But at least it's expensive.

I had a new england clam chowder here, but it was not anything special and tasted like any chowder I could have bought and made myself from Walmart. Not bad, but I expected it to be better. Not many menu options either. The large size of the soup was also pretty small. The employees seemed helpful but nothing special. Overall I would say it was okay.
10/10 best lobster rolls in the city!
Total rip off. Overpriced for an under seasoned, frozen tasting lobster.

Similarly consistent quality lobster, crab and shrimp rolls as other Luke's outlet, with seafood so fresh that I can taste the ocean. There is a certain inconsistency in this chain though. Chips and soda comes with the rolls in mid- town branch, only chips in another, chips and credit for soda at the third. Shouldn't all Luke's have standardized policies?

Terrible service.

We came in on a Saturday for lunch, and were spoken to so rudely! Snide remarks by the only person on staff, and comments rude even by New York standards. Expected an enjoyable lunch, ended up leaving without picking up our food. Lukeâ€™s Lobster isnâ€™t what it once was. Wonâ€™t be coming back

We used to love the place and would come several times a year, take some lobster combos and enjoyed them in Central Park. But today (June 8 2024) we had a shocking experience, the guy at the counter was very unwelcoming, without any reason. He seemed upset by our questions, even thought  there was nobody but us in the place. Ultimately we were so shocked by his attitude that we left without ordering.

Ci siamo trovati molto bene, siamo andati a domenica a pranzo e il posto era tranquillo. C'Ã¨ disponibilitÃ  di panini senza glutine ed erano tutti squisiti. Nel prezzo Ã¨ incluso anche un pacchetto di patatine senza glutine che abbiamo apprezzato.
Food was great, although a bit pricey

Local site for a brief expensive bite of exceptional freshly prepared seafood in soft toasty roll ... served bench and table with draft beer (or whatever your preferred drink). The lobster medley i ate comprised 3 different mayo flavorsâ€¦
Provato panino Lobster qui da Luke! Buonissimo, bellissimo anche il negozio tutto a tema!
Esperienza molto positiva,  sono stata sia in questo locale sia in quello di dumbo. Personale gentilissimo e panini super! Io ho provato tutti e 3 gusti proposti. Lo consiglio vivamente !
One of the freshest and succulent lobster roll in New York City. I would eat here over and over again.

My coworker introduced me to this place since I was craving some good lobster rolls, and oh man, this place is the bomb! I will definitely come back here again!!! The manager is also so nice! Love the restaurant. No crazy loud music, just a plain old restaurant where you can relax and eat!

If youâ€™re looking for a good lobster roll experience - thatâ€™s the place! ğŸ¦

We tried both Lukeâ€™s Trios (one including crab roll and shrimp roll) as well as lobster roll served warm, witch was my personal favorite :)

Service was super friendly and what I appreciated a lot was â€the source boardâ€informing where each meat on your plate comes from.
Excellent produit, service parfait

I went on a trip to New York and went to another branch, but the service here is so good and the taste is fresh. ğŸ¥ºğŸ¥ºğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
I highly recommend it ğŸ¥ºğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
The service is not good at other branches, but the owner here is really nice and takes care of it a lot
ã… -ã…œI want to bring my parents when they come on a trip. ğŸ˜­ Koreans, go here!!

ë§›ìˆëŠ” ëìŠ¤í„°!!!

Great little lunch spot. Freshest most tasty lobster roll I've ever had. I ordered Luke's Trio which is a trio of rolls with crab, prawn and lobster. Each roll was delightful, all with equally unique different delicious flavours. Nice ambience in the place and service was very good.

Seconda volta in questa catena specializzata in "Lobster Rolls" .
Il prodotto Ã© buono e fresco, il prezzo Ã© in linea con i costi di Manhattan.
Sfortunatamente il locale era un po' sporco e quando si deve mangiare sul posto non Ã© il massimo.
Ho preferito il locale situato vicino Wall Street.

Honestly, wouldâ€™ve given them a 5-Star rating if we just had the lobster roll. It was absolutely stuffed with thick CHUNKS of soft sweet sweet lobster and it was just delicious, especially if you enjoy being able to actually taste the lobster and not be overwhelmed by the butter and sauces/mayo that some places tend to stuff their rolls with to overcompensate for the lack of lobster meat. NOT here.

Yes, the portion size is slightly small for the price BUT the flavour more then compensates for it.

The lobster Mac and Cheese, on the other hand, lacked much lobster. There were only two pieces in ours, in fact. But the m&c was creamy and soft so it wasnâ€™t bad overall, just expected more lobster.

Staff are super friendly and amazing too!

lobster can't taste bad so obviously it was delicious. the sampler was a good way to try out the shrimp, lobster, and crab (each piece was 2oz whereas the regular size was 4oz & larger size was 6oz which just has more meat). this place is if you're willing to spend a good amount of money for yummy sandwiches. understandable for fresh seafood. but hey at least they give you a free bag of chips lol

Iâ€™m not a lobster/seafood fanatic but the lobster rolls are 5 stars, perfectly seasoned, full of flavor and not overdone on the butter. Shrimp and crab rolls were good but nothing crazy.

As some have mentioned, the portion sizes are small and did not fill me up. Lobster roll is on a hot dog size bun. Given the price point I was expecting a bit more, would have paid an extra $5 for a hero sized roll. Better for a lunch or someone who prefers a smaller portion.

Decor was inviting, small place, normal service. Hybrid of casual fast food and sit down style (waited 8-12 min for food to come out). Itâ€™s in the category of â€˜am I suppose to tip or not?â€™

5* for the lobster roll quality and visual appearance of food.
4* for the rest of the food and atmosphere
3* for the price to portion ratio ($$$ is probably more accurate)
Came here before heading to Central Park and thought the lobster was really fresh! I got the trio option and loved each flavor. So happy I got to try this place while visiting New York!

Really great place to grab a bite before visiting the Met.
Lobster roll is absolutely freakin delicious, I recommend the lobster sampler set because the spicy honey butter roll is so freakin good!!!!ğŸ¤¤ğŸ¤¤ I wish they would have a full lobster roll with only spicy honey butter though because I can't get enough of it.
Poppyseed slaw is also a very good side as it's not too expensive, adds veggie to your meal, and it just tastes so good.
Also the staff was very friendly (not overbearing which I like too). Many people seem to get take out so there were a lot of seats Sunday lunchtime.

This place is going on my recommended visit list for when my friends ask for recs for NYC restaurants :P

Was in UES yesterday, our old neighborhood, decided to walk around and ended up having dinner here.

First time at a Luke's Lobster so I was trying to not have the highest expectations versus what we've enjoyed in Newport, RI. Turned out to be really good!

I ordered the lobster roll with bisque and drink, opted to upgrade to a 6 oz rosÃ© for an additional $8. Hubby had the crab roll + lobster mac & cheese. And yep, strategically always good for sharing everything! Their bisque was deliciously comforting. The lobster mac & cheese was actually surprisingly really good. Hubby enjoyed the crab roll and I also loved the lobster roll. They have a small outdoor dining area outside and on a beautiful not so cold evening, this was absolutely perfect!

Staff were also great. Polite, smiling, actually liked taking care of customers type. May actually use that loyalty card as it works for UWS branches too! On our way out, we waved and thanked the team who took care of us, with a quick thumbs up! Thanks guys! This will definitely help satisfy our New England cravings until it's safe to be traveling again! We'll be back!

Iâ€™m all about this lobster rolls ğŸ¤©
I try these for the first time in Miami and since then, every time I go to the US I look for the nearest store!!
Itâ€™s hard to decide whether the lobster or the crab roll ğŸ˜… I just love them both.
This store at Upper East Side is so cool, they made it just as a fishermanâ€™s tavern, the staff is great, always smiling!
What else can I say? Just go and enjoy!

Amazing lobster roll, tons and tons of tender, juicy lobster meat cooked to perfection in a roll toasted with garlic butter, with thyme and herbs sprinkled on top. With a side of chips and coleslaw, what more can a man ask for?

Coleslaw was as one might expect, crunchy fresh cabbage and carrots in a savoury tangy dressing, topped with some cracked pepper.

A big plus is that the Lobsters come from a sustainable source and are farmed ethically. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!

A small but very good restaurant in the style of a fast food lobster place. The menu is limited to a small number of items. The lobster rolls are great and the cole slaw is very good. There is no wait staff but the kitchen will bring out your food. There is only a handful of tables here.

Food has phenomenal flavor, the Mac and cheese was nice and hot, although I was disappointed that for an 8oz cup @$15 the cup was not full to the top as you can see in the photo. But otherwise well done. The truffle lobster roll is the best, soft and tender.

Yummm delicious.my first time there as soon we came in we was services the place was not pack .and customer service was fast.its a nice small cozy place with seating wish its a plus. I was caugh of guard cuz I didn't know the lobster andâ€¦
Tried the regular lobster rolls and the hot honey and truffle rolls.  The hot honey was my favorite.  Would go again, but it wasnâ€™t the best ever.

Friendly service, delicious lobster (and shrimp), nice decor and a decent view, all in a small package.

My companions and I recently chose to lunch at Lukeâ€™s. We wouldâ€™ve preferred a warm, buttery, lobster roll, but Lukeâ€™s serves their shrimp and lobster chilled. The wait time for our food was about 10-15 minutes. Not a big deal, unless youâ€™re as hungry as we were. The seafood was tasty and the buns/rolls were equally delicious. Itâ€™s entirely possible that I closed my eyes as I took each bite.

Lukeâ€™s is pricey (to be expected since itâ€™s quality seafood in Manhattan), but I like that they offer incentives. If you download their app theyâ€™ll give you a free beverage. On my birthday I was surprised with a coupon for a free shrimp roll.

If youâ€™re looking for a fresh (chilled) shrimp or lobster roll, this is your place.
Didn't expect the rolls to be cold but still totally great lobster,  crab, and shrimp rolls my date and I had.  Mmmm. She killed hers lol

Decided to give them a shot back in December and ordered the lobster grilled cheese, which in my opinion was a bit lackluster overall. For $13 I felt like it deserved a bit more lobster.

Fast forward a few months and here I was hesitant to go back to try the lobster roll but noticed they also had a shrimp roll on the menu so I decided to gave that a shot. I have to say, the shrimp roll was pretty good.

I had a bad experience with this spot.

I walked past the door around 7:45pm on a weekend night and it took 5 minutes before anyone showed up to take my order.

When someone finally did take my order, I was asked to sign my receipt which asks you to tip. It's already expensive as is ($24 for a trio with fries and drink) and I felt swindled by their tipping practice especially since they don't even have table service here.

One this one particular experience it took over 20 minutes to get my food. A group of four had arrived 5 minutes after me and had not only gotten their food first but had also finished eating before my meal was even brought out to me.

However, I do like the ambience and I'm a fan of Luke Lobster's buttered rolls so that's the only reason why I didn't give this place a one star review.
Lobster education is visually all over the restaurant. And I am thinking the education made the lobster taste better really fresher.

Had the lobster roll with clam cowder. Soup was delicious, a bit on the salty side, well flavor with ingredients. Serve hot enough to burn your tongue. As for the lobster roll, why is it so cold? Even the toasted bread is cold. Would be much more delicious is it's hot and freshly made, feels pre-made and left in fridge.

Good sandwich with lobster even if i prefer the most simple one: just lobster without any sauce or topping.
In here they put some pepper and a special sauce that cover a little the actualâ€¦
